metadata.title: CVE-2021-45444 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - low
metadata.description:
In zsh before 5.8.1, an attacker can achieve code execution if they controla command output inside the prompt, as demonstrated by a %F argument. Thisoccurs because of recursive PROMPT_SUBST expansion.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45444` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zsh - 5.8.1-1
zsh-common - 5.8.1-1
zsh-static - 5.8.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zsh package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.8.1-1').
